channel.title: Ars-Technica on Panz3r News
channel.description: Recent content in Ars-Technica on news.panz3r.dev

item.title: Instagram bans top anti-vaxxer Robert F. Kennedy Jr. over COVID falsehoods
item.description: Kennedy has a long history of spreading dangerous misinformation on social media.

item.title: Why are General Motors and Will Ferrell trolling Norway?
item.description: 54 percent of new cars in Norway are EVs, but it’s a hard model to replicate.

item.title: Fauci: Vaccines for first-graders could be authorized by September
item.description: Trials need to prove the vaccine is safe and effective in children.

item.title: Adventures in Vim: Lee and Jim figure out how to change comment colors
item.description: Stop me if you’ve heard this one: Two senior sysadmins walk into a ~/.vimrc …

item.title: Disney fires Mandalorian’s Gina Carano over “abhorrent, unacceptable” posts
item.description: Report claims that pressure had mounted for months: “Today was the final straw.”

item.title: CDC study backs mask doubling with exposure to risky particles down 83%
item.description: Data has lots of caveats, but it’s not a bad idea to up your mask game.

item.title: A lithium-ion upgrade for your car, but not the one you’re expecting
item.description: We try out a 12V lithium-ion battery upgrade for your car.

item.title: Breached water plant employees used the same TeamViewer password and no firewall
item.description: Shortcomings illustrate the lack of security rigor in critical infrastructure environments.

item.title: United Airlines orders 200 vertical-takeoff electric airplanes
item.description: Startup Archer received investments from United Airlines and Stellantis.

item.title: A terabyte isn’t what it used to be—14% of Internet customers use more
item.description: Terabyte-using customers doubled from 7% to 14% as pandemic wore on.

item.title: HBO Max signs “adult” cartoon series based on Scooby-Doo’s Velma
item.description: Six other new series, including return of Lord and Miller’s MTV classic Clone High.

item.title: Google, Facebook tell SCOTUS it should be harder for you to sue them
item.description: The argument boils down to “if you don’t know we messed up, it can’t hurt you.”

item.title: Authorities bust SIM-swap ring they say took millions from the rich and famous
item.description: SIM-swapping is a worldwide scourge. Law enforcement is trying to make a dent.

item.title: Netflix acquires the rights to all 22 Redwall books, plans film and series
item.description: The film will be written by Over the Garden Wall’s Patrick McHale.

item.title: Oracle’s TikTok acquisition reportedly “shelved” indefinitely
item.description: Former admin. made a big deal of TikTok’s alleged security risks… until it forgot.

item.title: With Trump gone, Huawei tells Biden it’s not a security threat
item.description: With a new president in town, Huawei CEO says he would welcome friendlier relations.

item.title: Past coronavirus infections don’t seem to help with SARS-CoV-2
item.description: Neither T nor B cells seem to use memory of one virus to attack the other.

item.title: Super Mario 3D World + Bowser’s Fury review: Everything old is new again
item.description: Another unearthed Wii U classic paired with a new, somewhat repetitive diversion.

item.title: How Cubans make island Internet work for them
item.description: Cuba has been increasing Internet access, but the current digital divide grows, too.

item.title: SpaceX Starlink opens preorders, but slots are limited in each region
item.description: A $99 deposit today gives you a chance at service in the second half of 2021.

item.title: WHO team rejects lab origin of coronavirus, focuses on animals, frozen food
item.description: Meanwhile, China still clings to possibility the virus originated in another country.

item.title: macOS Big Sur 11.2.1 addresses MacBook Pro charging issues
item.description: There are also supplemental updates for Catalina 10.15.7 and Mojave 10.14.6.

item.title: Zero-days under active exploit are keeping Windows users busy
item.description: Microsoft and Adobe issue patches to stop malicious attacks in the wild.

item.title: We now have new evidence that Richard III murdered the princes in the tower
item.description: New research lends credence to the account of Sir Thomas More.

item.title: ISPs step up fight against SpaceX, tell FCC that Starlink will be too slow
item.description: SpaceX’s FCC broadband funding faces more opposition from telco trade groups.

item.title: Bunches of Amazon Fire tablets are back on sale today
item.description: Dealmaster also includes AirPods Pro, portable speakers, lap desks, and more.

item.title: UAE “Hope” probe successfully reaches Mars, two more following shortly
item.description: 2021 marks both the 50th anniversary of the Emirates and the first landing on Mars.

item.title: Disney redundancy: Fox CGI-animation studio behind Ice Age, Rio to shut down
item.description: Blue Sky, formed in TRON’s ’80s wake, leaves behind legacy of billions in cartoon sales.

item.title: Android 12 leak appears to show major redesign with color-changing UI
item.description: It looks like the entire UI picks colors from your wallpaper.

item.title: After several SUVs, Audi’s next electric car is the handsome e-tron GT
item.description: The e-tron GT starts at $99,900 and is closely related to the Porsche Taycan.

item.title: Sorry, small-phone lovers: The iPhone 12 mini was Apple’s 2020 sales flop
item.description: Analysts are questioning whether Apple should make an iPhone 13 mini after this.

item.title: Months after buying Uber self-driving project, Aurora signs Toyota deal
item.description: Aurora is planning to test self-driving Sienna minivans later this year.

item.title: So long Senator Shelby: Key architect of SLS rocket won’t seek reelection
item.description: Shelby said NASA’s exploration of space will “always” go through Alabama.

item.title: Cyberpunk 2077 developer hit with ransomware attack
item.description: Studio vows not to negotiate with hackers.

item.title: Mapping the ice on Mars that could support future missions
item.description: It’s not great to land near Mars' poles, and accessing water will be key.

item.title: The Mazda CX-30 Turbo: How I learned to love the crossover
item.description: The CX-30 was already our pick of the crossovers, and now it has a turbo.

item.title: Apple hardware chief Dan Riccio stepped down to focus on AR/VR
item.description: Also: Apple may make its own displays for Macs, iPhones.

item.title: Scary 22% vaccine efficacy in South Africa comes with heaps of caveats
item.description: South African data on AstraZeneca vaccine is as iffy as it is scary.

item.title: Proposed Sec. 230 rewrite could have wide-ranging consequences
item.description: Sec. 230 reform bills are already pouring into this Congress.

item.title: US drops suit against Calif. net neutrality rule, but ISPs are still fighting it
item.description: California law still faces court challenge from broadband-industry lobby groups.

item.title: Computer intruder tried to poison Florida city’s drinking water with lye
item.description: Change boosting sodium hydroxide level was reversed before anyone got hurt.

item.title: Parler’s ownership offer to Trump and possible Russian ties probed by Congress
item.description: Committee seeks info on financial ties to Russians, negotiations with Trump org.

item.title: A couple clings to shared past amid a memory-wiping pandemic in Little Fish
item.description: “How can you build a future if you keep having to rebuild the past?”

item.title: Android barcode scanner with 10 million+ downloads infects users
item.description: Researcher says Google hasn’t removed the malicious app, so onus is on end users.

item.title: Raspberry Pi OS added a Microsoft repo. No, it’s not an evil secret
item.description: Adding Microsoft’s repository allows Pi users to “apt install code” and be done.

item.title: Terraria developer cancels Google Stadia port after YouTube account ban
item.description: Hit indie game developer tells Google, “Doing business with you is a liability.”

item.title: Oldest DNA from poop contains a Neanderthal’s microbiome
item.description: The Neanderthal microbiome wasn’t so different from ours, a recent study suggests.

item.title: Soon, you may be able to change the default music service in iOS
item.description: “Hey Siri, stop making me say ‘on Spotify’ 40 times a day.”

item.title: Tesla buys $1.5 billion in bitcoin, sending its price soaring
item.description: “I make jokes about Dogecoin, but they are really meant to be jokes,” Musk said.

item.title: Super Nintendo World apparently took scenery from a Mario fangame
item.description: Telltale cactus mirrors original sprite from Newer Super Mario Bros. Wii mod.

item.title: Apple/Hyundai car talks ended fruitlessly, report says
item.description: Rumors of an Apple Car are still just rumors.

item.title: The connected battlespace, part two: The fault in our (joint) stars
item.description: Joint All-Domain Command � Control (“JADC2”) is the new hotness—but will it really work?

item.title: “90 bugs left”: Rare devs talk about the nearly completed Goldeneye 007 remake [Updated]
item.description: Members of the 360 remake’s dev team tell all—including the reason it was canceled.

item.title: Marvel drops action-packed 2-minute Falcon and the Winter Soldier trailer
item.description: Anthony Mackie, Sebastian Stan reprise their titular roles in new Phase Four series.

item.title: ABL Space tapped to launch the first orbital rocket from Britain
item.description: “The ABL system is relatively easy, quick, and cost-effective to deploy."

item.title: As cars get heavier, even small speed differences matter in a crash
item.description: A study on speed and crashes has me pining for lightweight cars.

item.title: A curious observer’s guide to quantum mechanics, pt. 5: Catching a wave
item.description: When it comes to quantum mechanics, confinement is not necessarily bad.

item.title: YouTube’s lo-fi music streams are all about the euphoria of less
item.description: Lo-fi hip-hop channels have created a community for minimalist escape.

item.title: Review: The Dig brings a famous archaeological find to vivid life
item.description: This tale of the famed Sutton Hoo excavations is based on the novel by John Preston.
